meanings.definition: A type of shrub or small tree.
meanings.sent1: The buist in the garden has beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: I planted a buist in my backyard for some shade.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the buist as a hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The buist stood tall like a guardian in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The colorful buist brightened up the landscape.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with the head.
meanings.sent1: The soccer player tried to buist the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally buist his head on the low doorway.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy would often buist into furniture.
meanings.sent4: She felt like her headache was trying to buist through her skull.
meanings.sent5: The ram buist the gate open with a powerful force.

meanings.sent1: The Buist family has a long history in Scotland.
meanings.sent2: I met a person with the last name Buist at the event.
meanings.sent3: Mr. Buist was known for his love of bagpipes.
meanings.sent4: The Buist clan gathered for a traditional Scottish celebration.
meanings.sent5: The Buist crest displayed a majestic lion.
